title: Museum-Inspired Home in Los Angeles Built for Restaurateur Michael Chow Asks $69.9M
text:
A gargantuan Los Angeles mansion built for Michael Chow, the restaurateur behind the celeb-favorite eatery Mr. Chow, and his ex-wife, Eva, returned to the market Wednesday with a price tag almost as high as its ceilings.



The 30,000-square-foot mansion in affluent Holmby Hills—reportedly modeled after Madrid’s Reina Sofia Museum—is asking $69.9 million.



More: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen Chop More Than $5M Off Boston-Area Home

The pair bought the site in 1991 for $3.5 million, property records show, and had the home built from scratch, with construction taking over seven years, according to listing broker Kurt Rappaport of Westside Estate Agency.



The former couple first tried to part with the home in October last year for $78 million, listing records show, the same year as their divorce after 26 years of marriage.



Mr. Rappaport declined to comment on who has been using the home most recently, and Mansion Global could not confirm if the ownership of the home is still shared.



The property, completed in the mid-2000s, was created to showcase the former couple’s collection of antiquities and contemporary art, complete with abundant wall space and “museum-quality” rooms with soaring ceilings, according to the listing that Mr. Rappaport shares with his colleague Carl Gambino.



The gated compound comprises a main house with a 30-foot high entryway with 400-year-old Moorish columns and carved ceilings, an Art Deco library, intricately carved wood-burning fireplaces and a roof terrace.

There’s also a three-story guesthouse with a home cinema, an entertainment complex, an outdoor ballroom and manicured grounds, the listing said.



“The house itself is a work of art, it’s unlike anything else,” Mr. Rappaport said. “The location is a good as it gets. Combine that with the uniqueness and architectural beauty and every amenity that everyone is looking for today… It’s a collectors item.”



Earlier this year Mr. Chow, 80, and his wife, Vanessa Rano, 30—whom he married in February—spent a total of $12.7 million buying two neighboring Los Angeles homes from pop star Katy Perry, Mansion Global reported.



Both homes are located on Hollywood Hills’ Mulholland Drive and were previously owned by oil heiress Aileen Getty, who sold them to Ms. Perry in 2013.



A request for comment placed with a publicist for Mr. Chow’s restaurant was not immediately returned.



Variety first reported the listing.
